intro: Astragalus purshii var. typicus, commonly known as the Pursh's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe. It has a deep root system that helps it survive in arid conditions, and it plays a role in soil stabilization. Astragalus purshii var. typicus is also valued for its ecological importance as a food source for various pollinators and wildlife.
